intro: Tapinanthus bussei, commonly known as the parasitic orchid, is a hemiparasitic plant that derives some of its nutrients from host plants. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is native to regions of Africa, including South Africa. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are often white or yellow in color. Its roots form specialized structures called haustoria, which attach to the roots of its host to extract water and nutrients. Despite its parasitic nature, Tapinanthus bussei plays a role in ecosystem dynamics by influencing the growth of its host species.
